(9) Speed and Safety for API Products

  • API products should be easy to add, change, and remove
    • This may apply only to the public and partner APIs
    • Mature API strategies look at every capability as an API product
  • Traditional enterprise IT can take a long time to approve anything
    • Only a fraction of these blockers are rooted in business needs
  • The Web allows permissionless decentralized innovation at global scale
    • Minimal technical requirements (Internet connectivity and URI/HTTP/HTML)
    • Services start, evolve, and die in a feedback loop for individual services
    • Harder to grasp and manage than one centralized implementation platform

How to do Microservices? Erik Wilde (@dret): APIs and Microservices

(13) Following the Letter

  • There are three basic Microservice Prerequisites [https://martinfowler.com/bliki/MicroservicePrerequisites.html]:
    • Rapid provisioning: Stand up new servers in hours
    • Basic monitoring: Observe technical and business issues
    • Rapid application deployment: Quickly deploy services to test and production
  • Many automation solution nowadays revolve around containers and related approaches
    • Use containers such as Docker [https://www.docker.com/] as development/deployment platform
    • Use orchestration such as Kubernetes [https://kubernetes.io/] for managing containers
    • Use a service mesh such as Istio [https://istio.io/] for container insight and controls


How to do Microservices? Erik Wilde (@dret): APIs and Microservices

(14) Following the Principle

  • The idea and goal of microservices is to decouple implementations
    • Encapsulate implementations and only allow API interactions between them
    • Polyglotism allows teams to choose the tools that work for them
    • Continuous Delivery streamlines the way from development to production
  • The microservices principle simply is enterprise IT understanding the Web
    • Components communicate through network-level standardized interfaces
    • Implementation details are completely invisible to the outside
    • Components can be added/scaled/modified/replaced individually and easily
